section.name: Encryption Profile
section.p: To use Encryption Profile, you have three options:

ul.li: You may use TLS Mutual Authentication with a symmetric secret key. (TODO: finish this description)

You may install a certificate which has been signed by a trusted Certificate Authority (CA). This approach generally has the advantage of requiring almost no configuration effort on the client/sending side, but there is generally a cost associated with obtaining a certificate which has been signed by a CA. This is a good approach if you have a single application (e.g. an interface engine or a regional repository) which will receive messages from many sources.
You may use a self-signed certificate. Self-signed certificates provide excellent security at the expense of requiring extra configuration on the client side.
